content.rendered:
Presley and Cory celebrated their marriage with a late summer wedding featuring romantic, soft pink details and a stunning view of Nashville at The Bridge Building. 

These two first met at The College of Pharmacy at Union University. Years later, in 2018, Cory proposed to Presley in Napa, Calif. on top of a castle! 

When it was time to start planning their wedding, Presley and Cory knew they wanted a venue that would showcase Nashville since most of their guests were from out of town, and what better place than The Bridge Building? 

On the big day, the couple decided not to do a first look, so Cory first saw his bride as her dad walked her down the aisle. To them, it was one of the most memorable moments of the day. (You might want to grab a tissue before you scroll to see his sweet reaction!)  

After Presley and Cory exchanged their vows, guests found their way to a cocktail hour to sip on chardonnay as the couple took more photos just  before the sunset. 

At the reception, guests selected a plated dinner of honey balsamic chicken with roasted heirloom carrots and goat cheese polenta, bourbon-glazed salmon with grilled asparagus, and peppercorn melange risotto, or a rosemary maple pork chop with creamed kale and parmesan polenta fries. 

After a few sweet toasts, Presley and Cory kicked off a night full of fun and dancing with their first dance to “Don’t Want To Miss a Thing” by Aerosmith. 

Scroll on to see more details of their romantic riverfront wedding at The Bridge Building!

WEDDING DETAILS

Date: September 26th, 2020
Happy Couple: Presley and Cory
Location: The Bridge Building
Colors: Blush, Rose Gold and Navy
Photographer: Tricia Michael
Florist: Forget Me Not Designs
Dress: Grace Loves Lace
Suit: Bonobos
Linens: Music City Tents
DJ: DJ Dan Buckley
Catering & Bar: The Bridge Building
Production Design: Nashville Lighting & Production
Planning: Megan & Libby | IH

excerpt.rendered: A riverfront ceremony and pink and navy reception at The Bridge Building.
